verses.text_plain: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;
verses.verse_html: 1The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

verses.text_plain: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
verses.verse_html: 2To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;

verses.text_plain: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;
verses.verse_html:
3To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity; ▼
▼ equity: Heb. equities

verses.text_plain: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.
verses.verse_html:
4To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion. ▼
▼ discretion: or, advisement

verses.text_plain: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
verses.verse_html: 5A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:

verses.text_plain: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
verses.verse_html:
6To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings. ▼
▼ the interpretation: or, an eloquent speech

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the interpretation: or, an eloquent speech
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the interpretation: or, an eloquent speech

verses.text_plain: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.verse_html:
7The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction. ▼
▼ the beginning: or, the principal part

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the beginning: or, the principal part
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the beginning: or, the principal part

verses.text_plain: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
verses.verse_html: 8My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

verses.text_plain: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
verses.verse_html:
9For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck. ▼
▼ an…: Heb. an adding

footnotes.body_html: ▼ an…: Heb. an adding

verses.text_plain: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
verses.verse_html: 10My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

verses.text_plain: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:
verses.verse_html: 11If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

tokens.text: with us, let us lay wait

verses.text_plain: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:
verses.verse_html: 12Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:

verses.text_plain: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:
verses.verse_html: 13We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

verses.text_plain: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:
verses.verse_html: 14Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:

tokens.text: us; let us all have one

verses.text_plain: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:
verses.verse_html: 15My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:

verses.text_plain: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
verses.verse_html: 16For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

verses.text_plain: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
verses.verse_html:
17Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird. ▼
▼ in the…: Heb. in the eyes of every thing that hath a wing

footnotes.body_text: ▼ in the…: Heb. in the eyes of every thing that hath a wing
footnotes.body_html: ▼ in the…: Heb. in the eyes of every thing that hath a wing

verses.text_plain: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.
verses.verse_html: 18And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.

verses.text_plain: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
verses.verse_html: 19So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

tokens.text: of every one that is greedy

verses.text_plain: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:
verses.verse_html:
20Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets: ▼
▼ Wisdom: Heb. Wisdoms, that is, Excellent wisdom

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Wisdom: Heb. Wisdoms, that is, Excellent wisdom
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Wisdom: Heb. Wisdoms, that is, Excellent wisdom

verses.text_plain: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,
verses.verse_html: 21She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,

verses.text_plain: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
verses.verse_html: 22How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

verses.text_plain: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
verses.verse_html: 23Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

tokens.text: unto you, I will make known

verses.text_plain: Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;
verses.verse_html: 24Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;

verses.text_plain: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:
verses.verse_html: 25But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

tokens.text: But ye have set at nought

verses.text_plain: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;
verses.verse_html: 26I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

verses.text_plain: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.
verses.verse_html: 27When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

verses.text_plain: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:
verses.verse_html: 28Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:

tokens.text: upon me, but I will not answer

verses.text_plain: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord:
verses.verse_html: 29For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord:

verses.text_plain: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.
verses.verse_html: 30They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.

verses.text_plain: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
verses.verse_html: 31Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

verses.text_plain: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
verses.verse_html:
32For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them. ▼
▼ turning…: or, ease of the simple

footnotes.body_text: ▼ turning…: or, ease of the simple
footnotes.body_html: ▼ turning…: or, ease of the simple

verses.text_plain: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
verses.verse_html: 33But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
